meanings.definition: In a manner that cannot be recovered or regained.
meanings.sent1: The toy was irretrievably lost in the deep forest.
meanings.sent2: The data was irretrievably deleted from the computer.
meanings.sent3: She irretrievably misplaced her keys in the most unexpected place.
meanings.sent4: The trust between them was irretrievably shattered.
meanings.sent5: The vase fell and broke irretrievably into countless pieces.

meanings.definition: In a way that is beyond repair or redemption.
meanings.sent1: The relationship was irretrievably damaged by the betrayal.
meanings.sent2: The ancient artifact was irretrievably destroyed in the fire.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to fix the broken watch irretrievably made it worse.
meanings.sent4: The bridge was irretrievably collapsed after the flood.
meanings.sent5: The mistake irretrievably altered the course of their lives.
